definitions: To bring down (one's foot) heavily on the ground or on something else.
To impress a pattern or mark on (a surface, object, or document) using an engraved or inked block or die.
To affix a postage stamp to (a letter or parcel).
To characterize or mark with a particular quality or feature.
examples: He stamped his foot in frustration.
The document was stamped with the official seal.
She stamped the letter before mailing it.
The experience stamped her for life.
